member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.Model.CreateProjectRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateProject operation. Creates an AWS Mobile Hub project.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Contents
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Contents.
ZIP or YAML file which contains configuration settings to be used when creating the project. This may be the contents of the file downloaded from the URL provided in an export project operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Name of the project.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
Default region where project resources should be created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.CreateProjectRequest.SnapshotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotId.
Unique identifier for an exported snapshot of project configuration. This snapshot identifier is included in the share URL when a project is exported.

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.Model.CreateProjectResponse
member.summary: Result structure used in response to a request to create a project.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.CreateProjectResponse.Details
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Details.
Detailed information about the created AWS Mobile Hub project.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectId.
Unique project identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.DeleteProjectResponse.DeletedResources
member.summary:

Resources which were deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.DeleteProjectResponse.OrphanedResources
member.summary:

Resources which were not deleted, due to a risk of losing potentially important data or files.

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.Model.DescribeProjectRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeProject operation. Gets details about a project in AWS Mobile Hub.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.DescribeProjectRequest.ProjectId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectId.
Unique project identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.DescribeProjectRequest.SyncFromResources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SyncFromResources.
If set to true, causes AWS Mobile Hub to synchronize information from other services, e.g., update state of AWS CloudFormation stacks in the AWS Mobile Hub project.

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.Model.DescribeProjectResponse
member.summary: Result structure used for requests of project details.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.DescribeProjectResponse.Details
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Details.

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportBundleRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ExportBundle operation. Generates customized software development kit (SDK) and or tool packages used to integrate mobile web or mobile app clients with backend AWS resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportBundleRequest.BundleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BundleId.
Unique bundle identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportBundleRequest.Platform
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Platform.
Developer desktop or target application platform.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportBundleRequest.ProjectId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectId.
Unique project identifier.

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportBundleResponse
member.summary: Result structure which contains link to download custom-generated SDK and tool packages used to integrate mobile web or app clients with backed AWS resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportBundleResponse.DownloadUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DownloadUrl.
URL which contains the custom-generated SDK and tool packages used to integrate the client mobile app or web app with the AWS resources created by the AWS Mobile Hub project.

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportProjectRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ExportProject operation. Exports project configuration to a snapshot which can be downloaded and shared. Note that mobile app push credentials are encrypted in exported projects, so they can only be shared successfully within the same AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportProjectRequest.ProjectId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectId.
Unique project identifier.

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportProjectResponse
member.summary: Result structure used for requests to export project configuration details.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportProjectResponse.DownloadUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DownloadUrl.
URL which can be used to download the exported project configuation file(s).

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportProjectResponse.ShareUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ShareUrl.
URL which can be shared to allow other AWS users to create their own project in AWS Mobile Hub with the same configuration as the specified project. This URL pertains to a snapshot in time of the project configuration that is created when this API is called. If you want to share additional changes to your project configuration, then you will need to create and share a new snapshot by calling this method again.

member.name: P:Amazon.Mobile.Model.ExportProjectResponse.SnapshotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotId.
Unique identifier for the exported snapshot of the project configuration. This snapshot identifier is included in the share URL.

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.AmazonMobileClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Mobile
AWS Mobile Service provides mobile app and website developers with capabilities required to configure AWS resources and bootstrap their developer desktop projects with the necessary SDKs, constants, tools and samples to make use of those resources.

member.name: M:Amazon.Mobile.AmazonMobileClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Mobile.AmazonMobileClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.Mobile.AmazonMobileClient.#ctor(Amazon.Mobile.AmazonMobileConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The AmazonMobileClient Configuration Object

member.name: T:Amazon.Mobile.IAmazonMobile
member.summary:
Interface for accessing Mobile
AWS Mobile Service provides mobile app and website developers with capabilities required to configure AWS resources and bootstrap their developer desktop projects with the necessary SDKs, constants, tools and samples to make use of those resources.
